listing.description: Properties such as this don't come around often in Walthamstow so when they do people sit up and take notice!Set over four floors and in need of full renovation is this aesthetically pleasing Victorian Period home.As you walk up the steps to the property you instantly fall in love with the house as it has significant kerb appeal.Once you walk in you take a step back in time. With so many original features and the original layout intact this becomes the dream of anyone wanting to put their mark on a property in this sought after area of East LondonWith a spacious rear garden to add to this once in a lifetime property, this ticks all the boxes for everyone.The Village area of Walthamstow has long been highly regarded with people in this area and has grown immensely in popularity in the last few years and people love the feel of the area as it set in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Walthamstow but also has a warm community feel to it with many people having lived here for a large part of their lives like the current owners.Please refer to the footnote regarding the services and appliances.What the Owner says:We have loved living here and raising our family here. Our home has been the source of many family get togethers and parties over the years but now we need somewhere smaller as the house is too big for us all.It was great when the children were growing up as they each had their own room and a lovely big garden to play in.As well as this there are great schools round here and we're not too far from Central Walthamstow where there is loads to do.Room sizes:Ground floorEntrance HallReception Room 1 14'0 x 14'0 (4.27m x 4.27m)Reception Room 2 14'0 x 11'1 (4.27m x 3.38m)Dining Room 10'1 x 9'1 (3.08m x 2.77m)Kitchen 14'0 x 6'0 (4.27m x 1.83m)Separate ToiletBasementCellar 18'1 x 17'1 (5.52m x 5.21m)First floorBedroom 1 13'1 x 11'0 (3.99m x 3.36m)Bedroom 2 11'1 x 11'0 (3.38m x 3.36m)Bedroom 4 7'1 x 4'1 (2.16m x 1.25m)BathroomSecond floorBedroom 3 10'11 x 10'0 (3.33m x 3.05m)OutsideRear GardenThe information provided about this property does not constitute or form part of an offer or contract, nor may be it be regarded as representations. listing.description: If space is on your wish list then look no further as this amazing home has enough to make you go 'wow' the very second you walk through the door. If you enjoy entertaining then you will simply love the size of the kitchen/diner. A huge space which is just perfect for get-togethers and socialising.If cosy evenings in front of the television are more your thing then the lounge will be right up your street. An equally brilliant size and with a gas log burner to keep you warm in the colder months. If you need somewhere to work from home, the study is ideal but it could also be the 5th bedroom. One of the downstairs bedrooms is currently set out as a formal dining room but has the flexibility to be used for either. You could even use it as a play room/family room for the kids. There is a further double bedroom and beautiful bathroom on this level giving you somewhere stylish to escape to for a well earned soak. If you like large bedrooms you will be bowled over by the sheer size of both upstairs bedrooms and there is an additional shower room too - making the layout of this home just ideal for family life. The large rear garden has everything you could ask for. A choice of patios for a barbecue and plenty of space for the kids to tire themselves out playing. When the sun gets too hot just let down the awning and enjoy some shade. With a large garage /workshop and a in and out driveway that allows for lots of parking, this immaculate tardis really does have it all.What the Owner says:We have lived here for over 25 years and that in itself says it all. We have loved every minute of it! It's a great location as it has all the benefits of the town centre, stations and schools within reach yet so much peace and quiet at the same time. The size of the garden was also a huge factor as we love gardening and are big fans of growing our own! Over the years we have extended and have completely transformed the house with everything having been carefully designed to make the most of every space. It's a brilliant party house as well as a wonderful family home. The flexible layout makes it ideal for everyone - even accommodating older relatives too. We will miss it dearly but know it's now time for a new family to relish the benefits of living somewhere like this.Room sizes:Entrance HallKitchen/Diner 24'5 x 10'10 (7.45m x 3.30m)Lounge (l-shaped) 22'5 x 10'8 (6.84m x 3.25m) plus 6'7 x 6'6 (2.01m x 1.98m)Dining Room/Bedroom 3 13'5 x 11'3 (4.09m x 3.43m)Bedroom 4 13'2 x 11'1 (4.02m x 3.38m)Study/Bedroom 5 11'1 x 8'5 (3.38m x 2.57m)BathroomLandingBedroom 1 19'8 x 13'8 (6.00m x 4.17m)Bedroom 2 17'0 x 12'2 (5.19m x 3.71m)Shower RoomFront GardenDrivewayGarage/Workshop 30'2 x 10'4 (9.20m x 3.15m)Large Rear GardenThe information provided about this property does not constitute or form part of an offer or contract, nor may be it be regarded as representations. listing.description: A pretty grade II listed family home located on Kelly Street; a curving tree lined terrace of brightly coloured stucco fronted houses with a variety of decorative mouldings to the front and mostly set behind shallow front gardens with elaborate ironwork railings. The overall ???feel??? of Kelly Street is one of uniformity with a repetition of architectural features within two strongly defined terraces. The traditional exterior of this super house belies the individual and colourful interior with its eclectic blend of sumptuous features and Victoriana. The accommodation in brief comprises two bedrooms, a bathroom and en-suite shower room, a super through reception/dining room and a large kitchen. To the rear of the property there is a landscaped London garden with spot lighting and water features along with sizable roof terrace; ideal for entertaining. There is planning permission for alterations to the property with further details available upon request.

listing.description: At over 1000 square feet, this spacious, split-level, two double bedroom period maisonette is situated in an extremely popular residential area, on a particularly sought after road (Fought over for catchment rights to Sudbourne School). This property is beautifully finished and makes the most of its large rooms. Split over three floors and with the large landing area it all adds to the light and airy feel throughout. The property has a flexible layout which could be used in order to suit a purchasers personal search criteria and there is access to a large loft space which could be utilised to add value, subject to the necessary permissions. The double aspect reception and eat-in kitchen is a great size with high ceilings, wooden floor boards and two period fire places. A fantastic room which runs the length of the building with views out onto the aesthetically pleasing terrace row opposite and the neighbouring gardens at the rear. The two double bedrooms are on separate floors and like the reception room, they have fantastic dimensions. The kitchen has all you need in terms of mod-cons and the bathroom is tastefully furnished with an adjacent utility area. There is a separate WC next to the lower bedroom. All in all, there are not many split-level properties on the market of this size, with your own private entrance, a cellar for storage and flexibility with the loft space.The property is a nine minute walk to the centre of Brixton, with Brixton Village on your doorstep and first stop on the Victoria Line. In the other direction purchasers will benefit from everything that Clapham has to offer within a ten minute stroll, the multitude of restaurants and bars and excellent transport links with two Northern Line underground stations; Clapham Common and Clapham North tube stations. Brockwell Park is a similar distance and an eighteen minute walk through the park brings you to Herne Hill Overground station and the many pubs and cafes of Herne Hill. Early viewings Recommended.

listing.description: Hunters Exclusive are delighted to offer buyers an opportunity to purchase one of the rarest period style maisonette???s Forest Hill has to offer. Not only is the property a rare find, but it is also being sold with the freehold for the building.In this description, we will cover some information about the property, the local schools, transport links and recreational facilities, however for those buyers that may not know Forest Hill so well we would encourage you to do some research on the location as it???s become one of South East London???s gems.In a time when much of large houses have historically been converted into many small apartments, it???s an absolute pleasure to find a building of this size separated in to only two properties and retains some stunning period features.This period style maisonette on Mayow Road offers some of the following period features to name a few:Large period style windows with stain glass featurePanelled doors stripped back to the woodA cast iron fire place with inset period tiles and granite style hearthA variation of cornicing and coving stylesPicture rails and ornate ceiling rosePeriod style window shutters and sash windowsStripped and varnished floor boardsPeriod style skirting boards and door architravesThe front garden faces easterly capturing the morning light whilst the rear garden faces westerly capturing the afternoon sun with the front garden offering gated parking for multiple cars allocated to this maisonette.The private rear garden is almost 80 feet in length and 35 feet wide. There is a raised, decked patio area and a garden shed offering approximately 128 sq ft of storage space which could be converted to a studio, workshop or other out building subject to consents.At over 2550 sq ft of internal space, the maisonette offers the same space as approximately two, three bedroom houses combined making it an extremely generous sized property which would rival many four and five bedroom houses locally.Although the property is being marketed as a four bedroom it can also be utilised as a three bedroom with two reception rooms and you will note from the images that the current owner is currently using one of the rooms as a dedicated dining area which is great for entertaining.Located on a wide tree lined road only approximately 0.7 miles to Forest Hill station and Sydenham station in the opposite direction, the property is well located for amenities and transport links.Forest Hill features several small independent high street conveniences including an award-winning butcher, some fantastic cafes, several boutique shops selling clothing and furniture as well as a few great modern, gastro and family friendly pubs.The Sylvan Post, Canvas and Cream and Stag and Bow all variously host, music events, exhibitions and craft days.However, if you require the convenience of a large well known supermarket and other known high street names, you will find Sainsbury???s, Boots and wh Smith along the high street too.Schools are A big attraction in forest hill:Church Rise is in proximity of several local schools which are in Ofsted's top 10%. In our experience, it???s unusual to find a house that is located to this many highly-rated schools. Four of those schools are as follows however there are other well-known local schools including an independent Montessori just a few minutes away:St Dunstan's College - Church of England, mixed, primary and secondary. This is a private school.Fairlawn - Public, mixed, primary, rated Ofsted "Outstanding".Kilmorie - Public, mixed, primary, rated Ofsted "Good".Dalmain - Public, mixed, primary, rated Ofsted "Good".TransportApproximately 0.7 miles away in opposing directions, Forest Hill and Sydenham stations offer services from both London Overground and Southern Rail some of the following travel times are available:London Bridge in approximately 17 minutes.Canary Wharf in approximately in 23 minutes.Shoreditch High Street in approximately 22 minutes.Victoria station in approximately 30 minutes.Alongside the train links you will find several bus routes from along Mayow Road and on the South Circular which includes routes 122 and 185 to Crystal Palace and Victoria to name a few.Local recreation:Mayow Park located along Mayow Road itself is a very popular green space located approximately 0.1 miles from the property. It???s well known for its caf?? as well as a bowling green, outdoor gym, water feature, nature reserve, tennis courts, cricket pitch and meadow area to name a few highlights.Off the high street in Forest Hill town centre you'll find Forest Hill pools and library both of which have undergone refurbishment. Forest Hill pools is known for its swimming pool facilities but is also a local leisure centre with a gym and fitness classes.The Horniman Museum and Gardens is a well-known local point of interest and can be found just beyond the town centre. It???s recognized as popular family entertainment venue and has been featured in "Time Out". With regular events, such as a farmer???s market, live music and seasonal festivals to name a few, there is always something to enjoy at the Horniman.You can read more about the Horniman museum and gardens here:Blythe Hill Fields is also located in to local area and offers recreational facilities such as the "Trim trails" which is an exercise trail. It also hosts local events where the residents of SE23 get to know each other better and enjoy the community spirit. You may look up details about Blythe Hill Fields on their website:Please contact Hunters on to obtain more information and book a viewing.

listing.description: An incredibly luxurious - 5 bedroom property within this brand new townhouse complex, set around 3 gated gardens with two grand arches at the entrance.* 5 Double Bedrooms* Open Plan Kitchen/Dining Room* Reception Room* Garage and allocated parking space in underground parking* 4 Bathrooms (3 En-Suite)* Underfloor Heating* Energy Efficiency: Band BDescription:An incredibly luxurious 5 bedroom property within this brand new townhouse complex, set around 3 gated gardens with two grand arches at the entrance.The property has been finished to an extremely luxurious standard throughout and includes a garage and a second allocated parking space. The property comprises 5 double bedrooms, 3 bathrooms (2 en-suite), a beautifully appointed open-plan kitchen/dining/living room as well as a separate reception room.Further features of this property include underfloor heating throughout, Comfort cooling to living areas and bedrooms, LED lights to underside of units, Intelligent mood lighting system with dimming facility controlled by Creston as well as a Crestron entertainment system.The local area:London Square Fulham is conveniently located just moments from the transport and entertainment hub of Fulham Broadway, and the idyllic village of Parsons Green. listing.description: Guide Price ??500,000 - ??525,000Laurels are delighted to present this stunning three-bedroom property, which has been recently extended and modernised. The property is located minutes from Worcester Park mainline station (Zone 4), fantastic schools and the local High Street with numerous shops and restaurants.As you enter the property you make your way through to the marvellous open plan living and kitchen area. The living space has been recently extended boasting underfloor heating, solid wood flooring throughout and full length bi-folding doors, which immerse the property in natural light. The living area leads out onto a raised decking area, which brings the garden inside and makes this the true heart of the home. The spacious kitchen has integrated modern appliances and is finished with beautifully stylish slate tiling.Upstairs the master suite consists of an immaculate double bedroom with dual aspect windows and a modern en-suite bathroom with walk in shower. This suite has recently been converted and is immaculately presented throughout and boasts innovative storage. There is a further two impeccable presented double bedrooms both with built in storage and a second spacious modern family bathroom.Further benefits include a fantastic garden, a large double garage with electricity and rear access offering space for a home office, gym or annexe. The property has a new boiler and electrics and there is ample storage offered throughout. The property also boasts a covered entrance porch and double driveway offering off road parking.The location makes it an ideal property both for commuters and people looking for a quiet residential road. Both Worcester Park Hight Street and Station (Zone 4, Approx. 25 minutes to London Waterloo) are 5 minutes??? walk away. The A3 is an easy 5 minute drive with access to London, the M25 and sits in the middle of both Heathrow and Gatwick airports. There is a small garden to the front, and a large to the rear the garden is approx. 100ft with mature borders, mainly laid to lawn, the property has been extended by its current owners at ground floor level, but would accommodate a further extension by three meters and a dormer loft conversion (stpp) which would increase the floor space to the house tremendously. There is easy access to the City, West End and national rail links via buses.The nearest station to Overton Road is Leabridge Road Station which is about 10 minutes to the North East. Also close to Leabridge road with its excellent amenities is a short walk away.A particular point of note is the property is situated very close to a new development site looking to create a residential led mixed use scheme. There will be a total of 9 blocks compromising of a total of 300 new home this includes 238 private residential units as well as 62 affordable new homes. Plans also include retail and gym space along with car parking and cycle provision. Once completed the this area is expected to increase considerably in future value.
